column3: Can you clean this up to match the new strings in 0.3.21, also can you only use the czech translation commit, instead of 20 that do various things?\n

Hello, I am not a developer and I am really new to using GitHub or GIT, so sorry for some troubles. I will very appreciate if you will give me some guide how to clone/pull and checkout only the right files, because everything I am studying very long time and can do mistake easily. Thanks.\n
The instructions from that repo are fairly out-of-date you can see http://forum.bitcoin.org/index.php?topic=8390.0 for more up-to-date ones.\n

Can you please send me latest english PO file? I can't find it. Thanks.

On Fri, Jun 3, 2011 at 15:10, TheBlueMatt <
reply@reply.github.com>wrote:

> The instructions from that repo are fairly out-of-date you can see
> http://forum.bitcoin.org/index.php?topic=8390.0 for more up-to-date ones.
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bi

There is no english po file, each po file maps English strings into another language.  As that thread points out, grab any po from any language and replace all the msgstr...s with a translation of msgid...\n
Speaking as a professional translator, I'd suggest only accepting direct translations from the English. Otherwise you get into the "game of telephone" sort of problem rather quickly.\n
No, each po has english and translated language, so you still have to translate from english.\n

The danger with the "grab any PO" advice above is that someone takes an existing EN->XX .po file and does the translation based on the XX rather than the EN. I confess, I'm being pedantic. I spent a few minutes trying to build a good example of how this can fail over three languages. The results weren't compelling, but translators can be _very_ creative! :)\n
